text: <@U0289USNA> <@U026PHQ3J> <@U026AP8CM> what's the next step for Trello #58 (<https://trello.com/c/o6E9HbBT/158-consider-how-to-remote-update-the-app>): Consider How to Remote Update The App? I've halfway-implemented Sparkle, but we need another bit of infrastructure before it'll work. Namely, a server where we can host archived builds, and serve the RSS "appcast" from.
the server exists...   you can use galapagos3 and server it from <http://cs.uncorkedstudios.com|cs.uncorkedstudios.com>
I personally don't know. It sounds like a sticky one. <@U0289USNA> <@U026PHQ3J> any additional ideas to try?
Nevermind thought this was about another trello card.
Cool let's use galapagos3.
Is that a long-term solution, can we keep it on that server without it impacting whatever else we have on there? Or, eventually will the server conversation need to come up with OMSI and Arizona?
<@U026PT0D7>: that domain is running a node.js express app that runs all the landing pages for the readinglist emails
you should be able to just put what you need in the public folder of the express app
cool
<@U0289USNA> how do I connect to galapagos3?
ssh galapagos3 !  (assuming you have it in your ssh config and have the rsa key and, yeah, you probably need stuff from me)
hah
^ <@U0289USNA> <@U026PHQ3J>
I think this is Bad, because Sparkle requires each version to be signed by the same author
also: <http://www.oregonlive.com/silicon-forest/index.ssf/2015/02/planar_shares_plunge_on_slower.html>

attachments.title: Planar shares plunge on slower growth forecast
attachments.text: Planar forecast considerably slower annual growth in the current quarter, just 23 percent.
